medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain woke him from sleep early the morning of admission. It is described as sharp and constant with no migration. There was no fever or chills, and the patient experienced diarrhea the night before admission after eating clam chowder, but none on the day of admission. Minimal nausea was noted on the day of admission, with no vomiting. The last meal was the night before admission.
